column1: The placenta may not work well due to pregnancy problems or social habits, such as: - Diabetes - Going past your due date - High blood pressure during pregnancy (called preeclampsia) - Medical conditions that increase the mother's chances of blood clots - Smoking - Taking cocaine or other drugs Certain medicines can also increase the risk of placental insufficiency.
A woman with placental insufficiency usually does not have any symptoms.
Treating high blood pressure or diabetes may also help improve the baby's growth.
Smoking, alcohol, and other recreational drugs can interfere with the baby's growth.
